intro: Leucostele chiloensis subsp. panhoplites, commonly known as the Chilean leucostele, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to southern Chile. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, temperate environments. The plant features slender, hairy stems and compound leaves with a distinct pinnate structure. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, which is characteristic of the carrot family. The subspecies is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
